Source CodeRelationshipTarget CodeComment
TriggerDefinition:(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinitionFHIR R5 ComplexType `TriggerDefinition` is representable via FHIR R4 extensions. Element `TriggerDefinition` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition`, but has no comparisons.
TriggerDefinition.type (type):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinition.typeElement `TriggerDefinition.type` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.type`, but has no comparisons.
TriggerDefinition.name (name):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinition.nameElement `TriggerDefinition.name` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.name`, but has no comparisons.
TriggerDefinition.code (code):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinitionElement `TriggerDefinition.code` has a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.
TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic (subscriptionTopic):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinitionNote that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` with an unmapped Canonical type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-canonical`. Element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` has a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.
TriggerDefinition.timing[x] (timing[x]):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinition.timing[x]Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`. Element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`.
TriggerDefinition.data (data):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinition.dataElement `TriggerDefinition.data` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.data`, but has no comparisons.
TriggerDefinition.condition (condition):(equivalent)http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition#TriggerDefinition.conditionElement `TriggerDefinition.condition` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.condition`, but has no comparisons.

name: ConceptMapR5TriggerDefinitionElementsForR4TriggerDefinition
title: Cross-version ConceptMap for FHIR R5 resources in FHIR R4
description: This ConceptMap represents the cross-version mapping of resource FHIR R5 for use in FHIR R4.

target.comment:
FHIR R5 ComplexType `TriggerDefinition` is representable via FHIR R4 extensions.
Element `TriggerDefinition` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition`, but has no comparisons.
Element `TriggerDefinition.type` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.type`, but has no comparisons.
Element `TriggerDefinition.name` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.name`, but has no comparisons.
Element `TriggerDefinition.code` has a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.

Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` with an unmapped Canonical type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-canonical`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` has a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.

Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]`, but has no comparisons.
Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.data` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.data`, but has no comparisons.
Element `TriggerDefinition.condition` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.condition`, but has no comparisons.
